page.title: 04NEWDIGATE VILLAGE
page.content: Green Belt Regulations restrict building of new houses and extensions to existing domestic properties. There are 10 medieval timber-framed houses including two former-Manors (Cudworth and Marelands.)and about 30 others of 17th,18th,& 19th century construction,all of which have been recorded by the Domestic Buildings Research Group,(Surrey). The Parish Council has nine elective members,and a part-time Clerk functioning in accordance with the Local Government Act,1972. A Community Centre comprising a village hall and recreation ground is administered by a committee representing Village Organisations. There is a Village Club seperately administered by a committee.
